result.markdown:
:::{.callout-note}
## Learning objective:

- Use tidyverse function for exploratory data analysis;
- glimpse()
- ggplot()
- Text mining using tidy data principles
:::

Load data:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ameshousing <- AmesHousing::make_ames()
```
:::


Load the libraries:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.4.0     ✔ purrr   1.0.1
✔ tibble  3.1.8     ✔ dplyr   1.1.0
✔ tidyr   1.3.0     ✔ stringr 1.5.0
✔ readr   2.1.4     ✔ forcats 1.0.0
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidymodels)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels 1.0.0 ──
✔ broom        1.0.3     ✔ rsample      1.1.1

✔ parsnip      1.0.3     ✔ yardstick    1.1.0
✔ recipes      1.0.4     
── Conflicts ───────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels_conflicts() ──
✖ scales::discard() masks purrr::discard()
✖ dplyr::filter()   masks stats::filter()
✖ recipes::fixed()  masks stringr::fixed()
✖ dplyr::lag()      masks stats::lag()
✖ yardstick::spec() masks readr::spec()
```

:::
:::


Explore the ames data:
- What’s the distribution of the outcome, Sale_Price?
- What’s the distribution of numeric variables like ...?
- How do selling price differ across ...?
